greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the sum of n's distinct prime factors below n.
comment: a(n) = A008472(n) - A010051(n) * n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 05 2013
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} prime(k) * x^(2*prime(k)) / (1 - x^prime(k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 13 2021
example: a(12)=5 because 12's distinct prime factors 2 and 3 sum to 5.
program: a105221 n = a008472 n - n * fromIntegral (a010051 n)
results.author: _Alexandre Wajnberg_, Apr 13 2005
